alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 3:56AM PST until January 03 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .A front will bring heavy rain to Del Norte and northern Humboldt Counties today. Lower elevation snowpack may rapidly melt leading to localized flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rain and snow melt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Del Norte Interior and Northern Humboldt Interior. * WHEN...From 10 AM PST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff and snowmelt may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain around half an inch per hour is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior
